text: George Edward Pateman (8 May 1910 – 1973) was an English professional footballer who played as a centre forward. He made 87 appearances in the Football League spread over eight clubs. ==Career== Born in Chatham,Frost, p. 403 Pateman spent his early career with Aveling & Porters, Canterbury Waverley, Gillingham, Portsmouth and Oldham Athletic. At Portsmouth he made two league appearances in October 1931. He moved from Oldham to Bradford City in June 1934, making one league appearance for the club,Frost, p. 387 before moving to Clapton Orient in July 1935. He later played for Reading, Accrington Stanley, Southport, Barrow and Shorts Sports. At Southport he scored four goals in thirteen league appearances between February and April 1937. ==Sources== * ==References== Category:1910 births Category:1973 deaths Category:People from Chatham, Kent Category:English footballers Category:Association football forwards Category:Gillingham F.C. players Category:Portsmouth F.C. players Category:Oldham Athletic A.F.C. players Category:Bradford City A.F.C. players Category:Leyton Orient F.C. players Category:Reading F.C. players Category:Accrington Stanley F.C.
